newsitem.title: USA: Avant! shares jump on two software contracts.
newsitem.headline: Avant! shares jump on two software contracts.

text.p: Avant! Corp. stock jumped 13 percent Friday after the software company said it won two contracts worth about $46 million over the next three years for its chip design products.
Shares of Avant!, based in Sunnyvale, Calif., rose $3.44 to $30.375 on Nasdaq after touching $31.375, the highest price since April.

Avant! said a major Japanese computer chip company signed a three-year contract for several of its software products, which help electrical engineers design and test chip designs. The order has a list price of $40 million. Avant! did not disclose the name of the customer.
Avant! also announced another three-year contract, worth $6 million, with an unnamed Korean chip company for the same products.

In the past month, Avant! has been announcing each significant contract to boost its image. The company's chief executive, Gerald Hsu, faces criminal charges and a possible prison term for allegedly stealing trade secrets from cross-town rival Cadence Design Systems Inc.
The company said the recent contracts show confidence in its managment and products.
Avant! said earlier this month that Lucent Technologies Inc. extended a long-term contract for more chip-design software. Terms of the deal were not disclosed.
